fs.fibu2.filter
Class FilterPool

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.filter.FilterPool

public class FilterPool
extends java.lang.Object

Several JournalModules use StackFilters for their views and sometimes it might be useful to copy an existing filter into another module without the need to recreate it from scratch. Hence each JournalModule can add/remove the StackFilters it uses to this pool. They can then be retrieved by other modules. More precisely, the pool stores the filter and returns it, whenever it is requested. A requesting module should always clone the filter retrieved to avoid side-effects, but there is no guarantee as to that.

Author:
Simon Hampe

          An information tripel containing a filter, its creator module and its name

Method Detail

getPool

public static FilterPool getPool(Journal j)
Returns:
The filter pool associated to a given journal. If it does not exist yet, it is created

addFilter

public void addFilter(StackFilter filter,
                      JournalModule owner,
                      java.lang.String name)
Adds a filter to the pool. This call is ignored, if the filter is already in the pool

Parameters:
filter - The filter to be added. It will be stored in form of a Preferences node
owner - The module in which the filter was created. Only used for rendering purposes
name - The name of the filter. This is usually something like the title of the tab of the view associated to the filter

setFilterName

public void setFilterName(StackFilter filter,
                          java.lang.String newName)
Changes the name of the filter (if it exists in this pool)

Parameters:
filter - The filter whose name should be changed
newName - The new name. If null, the empty string is used

removeFilter

public void removeFilter(StackFilter filter)
Removes the given filter, if it is contained in the pool
